extendedIngredients.name: fresh basil leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 C fresh basil leaves, chopped finely

recipes.title: Basil and Balsamic Italian Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees and spray a cookie sheet with nonstick spray.  Lay the chicken breasts smooth side down on the pan and squeeze half the lemon over the top, then sprinkle on a good amount of the salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder.  Flip the chicken over and repeat on the other side.  Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes until the juices run clear.  The time will depend on the size of your chicken breasts.While the chicken is baking, place the balsamic vinegar in a small skillet and bring it to a boil over medium high heat and allow it to reduce to a syrup like consistency, which takes about 5-8 minutes.In a small bowl, combine the chopped basil, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper then set aside.Once the chicken is baked, remove from the oven and layer on slices of tomato topped with slices of mozzarella cheese.  Return to the oven for a couple minutes until the cheese melts.To serve, top each chicken breast with the basil mixture and then drizzle the reduced balsamic vinegar over the top.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425 degrees and spray a cookie sheet with nonstick spray.  Lay the chicken breasts smooth side down on the pan and squeeze half the lemon over the top, then sprinkle on a good amount of the salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder.  Flip the chicken over and repeat on the other side.

Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes until the juices run clear.  The time will depend on the size of your chicken breasts.While the chicken is baking, place the balsamic vinegar in a small skillet and bring it to a boil over medium high heat and allow it to reduce to a syrup like consistency, which takes about 5-8 minutes.In a small bowl, combine the chopped basil, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper then set aside.Once the chicken is baked, remove from the oven and layer on slices of tomato topped with slices of mozzarella cheese.  Return to the oven for a couple minutes until the cheese melts.To serve, top each chicken breast with the basil mixture and then drizzle the reduced balsamic vinegar over the top.
